comment._content: The most likely match from the Royal Navy records at the National Archive is an Ernest Francis Bellamy, born 21st September 1900 who joined the Royal Naval Volunteer Reserve in 1918. His service number was Z/8207 and he was attached to the Bristol Division of the RNVR. His records at the National Archive are under reference ADM 337/12/288. discovery.nationalarchives.gov.uk/SearchUI/Details?uri=D7... Assuming that is the correct individual, then the most likely match on the General Registrars Office Index of Births is an Ernest Francis whose birth was recorded in the Long Ashton District of Somerset in the October to December 1900 quarter. The Long Ashton, South Somerset man appears to be recorded on the 1901 census as an "Er." Francis, aged 6 months and born Yatton, Somerset - the header across the top of the page isn't very clear but the Civil Parish is given as "Part of Yatton", the Ecclesiastical Parish as "St Mary Yatton" and the Rural District as "Long Ashton". In the space titled "Town of Village of Hamlet of", the census taker has helpfully written "Village" rather than the Village name. The head of the family is his father "Ar. Wm." Bellamy, aged 30 and a Domestic Gardener from Langford, Essex. His wife is "Al.Maud", aged 30 and from Yatton. Their other children at that point are:- "Leonard La"...............aged 9............born Yatton "Isabella (???)"............aged 7............born Yatton "Nina Maud"................aged 5...........born Yatton "Ar.Sid(??)..................aged 2...........born Yatton By the time of the 1911 census the family had moved to Lincolnshire. Father Arthur William, (40), was now a Licensed Victualler as well as a Gardener, and resided with his family at The Crown, Tinwell, Lincolnshire. He and his wife Alice Maud have been married for 20 years and have had 5 children, all then still alive. Alice Maud is described as "Assisting in Business" Children living with them at this time are:- Leonard Leslie (19) - Agricultural Machinery Fitter Isabel Dorothy (17) - Elementary School Teacher, Rutland County Council Nina Maud (15) - Dressmakers assistant Sidney Arthur (12) Ernest Francis (9) Apparently as at the start of 2013 the Pub is still there. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tinwell The death of an Ernest Francis Bellamy, born 21st September 1900, was recorded in the Stamford District of Lincolnshire in the April to June quarter of 1982.
